cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles W of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, expected to pass over Hispaniola, cross the Bahamas, and approach the southeast Florida coast before curving northward along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Florida coast (near or just north of West Palm Beach)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the Northwestern Bahamas (Andros, New Providence, Eleuthera, Abaco, Berry, Grand Bahama Island, Bimini)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for Puerto Rico, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, all coasts of the Dominican Republic and northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and the Southeastern & Central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire east coast of Florida northward to the Carolinas lies within the 5-day cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) are possible at the port beginning late Friday night or early Saturday with a peak probability of 32%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: East-facing beaches of Palm Beach County could see 1–3 ft of surge/inundation with higher waves if Isaias strengthens.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 3–6 inches, locally higher, leading to brief flash flooding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and very rough seas will hinder vessel movements and could force temporary port closure.
